meanings.sent1: She had to pingle all day to finish her homework on time.
meanings.sent2: The ants pingle tirelessly to build their anthill.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel decided to pingle away, gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: He had to pingle through the night to prepare for the exam.
meanings.sent5: The determined athlete continued to pingle despite the challenges.

meanings.definition: A small enclosed field or paddock.
meanings.sent1: The farmer let the sheep graze in the pingle.
meanings.sent2: The horses ran freely in the pingle behind the barn.
meanings.sent3: The children played tag in the small pingle behind the school.
meanings.sent4: The rabbits hopped around happily in the grassy pingle.
meanings.sent5: The cows gathered in the pingle for their afternoon rest.

meanings.sent1: She only needed a pingle of sugar for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: He added a pingle of salt to the soup for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The chef sprinkled a pingle of herbs on top of the dish.
meanings.sent4: A pingle of rain fell from the sky as the storm passed.
meanings.sent5: The child's laughter was just a pingle in the quiet room.
